Androgenetic alopecia (AGA) could possibly be related to SARS‐CoV‐2 infection as both conditions are considered to be androgen mediated.
60 Clinically significant AGA was found in 29 (71%) of the 41 Caucasian men with bilateral SARS‐CoV‐2 pneumonia hospitalized in two tertiary Spanish hospitals. In comparison, the prevalence of AGA among healthy Spanish Caucasian men was estimated at approximately 31–53%.
61 Future case‐controlled studies may potentially confirm AGA as a predictive factor for increased COVID‐19 severity and contribute to the development of antiandrogen therapy for SARS‐CoV‐2 infection.
